toc_entry.title: Is J.R. Shot?
toc_entry.description: The tenth anniversary of TV’s most popular nighttime series begs the question, How long can the Ewings’ doings hold our attention?.

toc_entry.title: Wonder Plane
toc_entry.description: Up in the sky, it’s a plane, it’s a helicopter—no, it’s a tiltrotor, the Texas hybrid that will soon revolutionize air travel.

toc_entry.title: What Does H.E.B. Stand For, Anyway?
toc_entry.description: As the president of Texas’ largest private grocery chain, Charles Butt learned that in order to be nice to his customers he had to be tough on his competitors. And vice versa.

toc_entry.title: Food Feud
toc_entry.description: For years Jamail’s was the queen of Houston grocery stores. Now the Jamail family is at odds, and two rival chains are getting ready for a major food fight.

toc_entry.title: The Night Lyndon Quit
toc_entry.description: For twenty years, the story behind President Johnson’s withdrawal has remained a mystery. Now, on the anniversary of his decision, his former secretary reveals the drama of LBJ’s biggest surprise.

toc_entry.title: Once Upon a River
toc_entry.description: Thirty-four years after his Pulitzer prize—winning Great River, historian Horgan publishes a moody sketchbook of his journey along the Rio Grande.

toc_entry.title: Miles And Miles Of Texas
toc_entry.description: The assignment was the chance of a lifetime to see the whole state, once and for all. At times pure pleasure and at times a feat of will, it was always and foremost a writer’s dream come true.

toc_entry.title: The Bowie Knife
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Whether a frontiersman needed to skin a bear, chop wood, or fight in a duel, Jim Bowie’s weapon was the tool of choice.

toc_entry.title: Eat Crow
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: Megadeveloper Trammell Crow bought farmland in Louisiana, but can his company’s big-city savvy make it pay?.

toc_entry.title: Juarez And Peace
toc_entry.subtitle: Television
toc_entry.description: When the network canceled the Hispanic cop show Juarez before anyone had a chance to see it, all of El Paso was up in arms. Peace, El Paso, peace.

toc_entry.title: Best Enemies
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: Dallas lawyers arlen Bynum and John Collins are personal friends and professional foes. They get a kick out of both roles.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Celebrating the extraordinariness of ordinary lives.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: REPORTER
toc_entry.description: Downtown San antonio gets a makeover; two for T-shirts; a spine-tingling story of a racehorse; the real winners at the Miss U.S.a. pageant; the Brownies go to marketing.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: You’ll never gas what the Sierra Club is up to now; impossible but true: the austin american-Statesman descends to a new low; Jesse Jones may have a solution for Texas’ economic problems.
